answers.answer: Assuming you are in your 30s, it's not uncommon to unmask hyperopia or farsightedness after pregnancy.  You want to make sure you haven't developed gestationaly diabetes (most OBs would have already checked for that but a simple blood test may not be a bad idea to make sure).  You need to either get a prescription for bifocal glasses to be able to see far and near or just simply buy 2 different pairs of over the counter reading glasses (not always a good option but if if works you save yourself money).  You want to keep the +1.25s for distance and buy a pair of +2.50 or +2.75 for reading if you decide to go the cheaper route.HV

title: Blurry Vision After Pregnancy
